text: The First National Bank Building at 402 Donoho St. in Jayton, Texas was built in 1912. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1997. It is a Classical Revival-style building with brick veneer and masonry bearing walls on a concrete foundation. It also served as the Kent County Courthouse in 1955. It was designed by architect Rockwell Henry Stuckey (1855-1936). It is also a Recorded Texas Historic Landmark. ==See also== *National Register of Historic Places listings in Kent County, Texas *Recorded Texas Historic Landmarks in Kent County ==References== ==External links== Category:Courthouses in Texas Category:National Register of Historic Places in Kent County, Texas Category:Neoclassical architecture in Texas Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1912
title: First National Bank Building (Jayton, Texas)
